page.title: 06Newquay's Fishing Industry
page.content:
On several days in 1984 one or two dazzling,white boats could be seen bobbing about in Fistral Bay.They must have done well because the local paper reported that Mr Treblock netted two tons of bass in two days,worth about Â£9000.Crew worked from seven in the morning till midnight on both days to bring the bass ashore.They had caught 140 stone of hake that week,so it was all very worthwhile
The main type of fishing in the winter months is trawling,although only about two boats operate all winter long. The main type of fish caught is Blond Ray,although a trawl net may contain anything from turbot to huss. The fish are taken to Newlyn or the Fishermen's cooperative at Bodmin.The fish are bought by agents who then send it to Billingsgate.
